com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications

Class PopOverShell

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.PopOverShell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FadeEffect.Fadeable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bubble, PopOverComposite

    public abstract class PopOverShell
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
implements FadeEffect.Fadeable
    PopOverShell provides a simple interface for popping a Shell on top of any Object that subclasses Control or implements CustomElementDataProvider

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PopOverShell.PoppedOverItem
      A convenience structure for PopOverShell.

      Constructor and Description
      PopOverShell(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control parentControl, CustomElementDataProvider customElementDataProvider)
      Provides the backbone for Custom Widgets that need a Shell popped over a Control or CustomElementDataProvider.

    • Field Detail

      • parentControl

        protected org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control parentControl

      • popOverShell

        protected org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell popOverShell

    • Constructor Detail

      • PopOverShell

        public PopOverShell(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control parentControl,
            CustomElementDataProvider customElementDataProvider)
        Provides the backbone for Custom Widgets that need a Shell popped over a Control or CustomElementDataProvider. If you're using a CustomElementDataProvider, pass the CustomElementDataProvider.getPaintedElement() as the parentControl.
        Parameters:
        parentControl - The control you want the PopOverShell to appear above. In the case of CustomElementDataProvider, pass CustomElementDataProvider.getPaintedElement().
        customElementDataProvider - The CustomElementDataProvider you want the PopOverShell to appear above (or null if you're using a Control)

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Shows the PopOverShell in a suitable location relative to the parent component. Classes extending PopOverShell will provide the Region via the abstract getAppropriatePopOverRegion() method.

      • toggle

        public void toggle()
        Toggles visibility of the PopOverShell. If the PopOverShell is visible, it will fade it from the screen, otherwise it will pop it up.

      • checkSubclass

        public void checkSubclass()
        Overrides:
        checkSubclass in class org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns whether the PopOverShell is currently visible on screen. Note: If you utilize PopOverShell.fadeOut(), this method will return true while it's fading. To determine if it's fading out, call PopOverShell.getIsFadeEffectInProgress
        Returns:
        Visibility state of the PopOverShell

      • fadeOut

        public void fadeOut()
        Fades the PopOverShell off the screen.

      • getIsFadeEffectInProgress

        public boolean getIsFadeEffectInProgress()
        Returns whether the PopOverShell is currently fading from the screen. Calls to PopOverShell.isVisible() will return true while the PopOverShell is dismissing.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the PopOverShell is currently fading from the screen

      • fadeComplete

        public boolean fadeComplete(int targetAlpha)
        Implemented as part of Fadeable.
        Users should not interact directly invoke this method.
        Specified by:
        fadeComplete in interface FadeEffect.Fadeable
        Parameters:
        targetAlpha - The targetAlpha you defined as part of the FadeEffect.
        Returns:
        True if the component is at the desired alpha, false otherwise (continues the FadeEffect execution).

      • fade

        public void fade(int alpha)
        Implemented as part of Fadeable.
        Users should not interact directly invoke this method.
        Specified by:
        fade in interface FadeEffect.Fadeable
        Parameters:
        alpha - The current alpha in the effect (will start at the target alpha and end at the target alpha).
